alert.note: Alert for Bering Strait Coast; Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; Yukon Delta Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Watch issued November 11 at 2:51AM AKST until November 14 at 3:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY EVENING THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Minor coastal flooding possible. * WHERE...Bering Strait Coast, Southern Seward Peninsula Coast, Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills and Yukon Delta Coast. * WHEN...From Sunday evening through late Monday night. * IMPACTS...Roads may be closed. Low lying property including homes, businesses, and some critical infrastructure may be inundated. Some shoreline erosion may occur. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Sustained southwest winds 30 to 35 mph are expected to build elevated water levels into Norton Sound and along the Yukon Delta beginning Sunday night. Elevated water levels of 4 to 7 feet above normal high tide may create minor coastal flooding of low lying areas and possible shoreline erosion through late Monday night.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.

area.areaDesc: Bering Strait Coast; Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; Yukon Delta Coast
